title: Which rock songs include classical guitar in them? - Quora

response.answer_text: Good answers already given. Here are a couple more, and if they’re not all strictly rock, too bad. . .I’m putting them here anyway! -Eric Clapton’s Unplugged version of Tears in Heaven. -Queen Innuendo (flamencoesque guitar spot by Steve Howe). -Pistolero by Juno Reactor, kind of a techno piece, but cool flamenco-like guitar by Billy Idol guitarist Steve Stevens. He uses a pick, but I’ll forgive him. Steven also has a whole album out of him playing rock pieces on nylon called “Flamenco a Go Go”. -Suzanne (and pretty much everything else) by Leonard Cohen. -Beatles: And I Love Her (Harrison, a Ramirez); Till there was you; I’ll be back. -Dee, Rhandy Rhodes (classical guitar version on the Tribute album). -To Live is to Die, Metallica. Battery is another piece that opens with classical guitar, though it has a slight saturated/overdriven sound. -Obsession-Confession by Slash (yeah. ..the one from Guns N Roses). . .sort of a nuevo flamenco piece. Its not really rock, but this one was actually a hit for him, and so unlike what he’s usually known for I feel like I should mention it. -Who Let the Dogs out, by the Baja men. (Yes, seriously) Has a classical guitar arpeggiated part the last 20 or so second of the song.

There are a lot but some of the most famous ones are: Wish You Were Here by Pink Floyd My God by Jethro Tull Greensleeves by the Jeff Beck Group Babe Im Gonna Leave You straddles Spanish guitar and classical And I Love Her and Ill Be Back by the Beatles Love Alive, Dream of the Archer (one of the most fabulous rock songs to use classical guitar) and Crazy on You by Heart
